(2010) }} }} '''''Wither''''' is a [[Single (music)|single]] and [[Extended play|EP]] by [[progressive metal]] band [[Dream Theater]],{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=126952|work=[[Blabbermouth.net]]|accessdate=2010-11-14|title= DREAM THEATER Releases 'Wither' EP - Sep. 14, 2009}} released on September 15, 2009,{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/newreleases/release.aspx?releaseID=336|accessdate=2010-11-14|title=ROADRUNNER "Wither [Digital EP]" - Dream Theater|work=[[Roadrunner Records]]}} it was their first EP since ''[[A Change of Seasons]]''. The EP contains the album version of the song "Wither", an alternative version of "Wither" featuring vocals and piano only, a demo of "Wither" with John Petrucci on vocals, and a demo of "The Best of Times" with [[Mike Portnoy]] on vocals. It is the band's final official release featuring Portnoy, who left the band in September 2010. It was released exclusively as a digital download and available from internet music retailers, although some physical promo copies were released to radio stations and are now in circulation on [[eBay]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2011}} ==Music video== The video features the band on tour in support for the album ''[[Black Clouds & Silver Linings]]'', scenes are shown playing live and also offstage events including meeting and greeting with fans during their Progressive Nation Tour. [[Mikael Ãkerfeldt]] of [[Opeth]] can also be seen in the video alongside [[Mike Portnoy]] during the band interviews.
